page.title: 02FARMING, CROPS & BUILDINGS
page.content: Most of our area is taken up with farms - the Stotfold Farms to the west and the Brierton Farms to the east. In June, when the area was researched, many of the fields contained crops - for the most part barley and wheat. Some fields were a colourful yellow on account of the popular oil seed rape. Also grown are potatoes, turnips, and grass for hay and silage. Much of the equipment on the farms is tied to this kind of farming. We saw tractors, combined harvesters, diggers, balers and seed drills. The buildings also reflected arable farming. At one farm the old barns had not been big enough so grain bins had been constructed. Over the years the bins also proved to be too small and now a huge barn is under construction to take 6,000 tons of grain after this year's harvest.
